body_content.explanation: a short description of someone's life, work, character, etc.
information about a person's life, work, interests, etc. on a social networking website:
examples: You can post your relationship status on your Facebook profile.

body_content.explanation: the amount of public attention and notice that something receives:
examples: We need to increase our company's profile in Asia.
There is a growing number of women in high-profile positions (= positions which they are noticed) in the government.

body_content.explanation: a side view of a person's face:
examples: Drawing profiles is somehow easier than drawing the full face.
The actor is photographed in profile, smoking a cigarette.

body_content.explanation: to write or publish a short description of someone's life, work, character, etc.:
examples: Every week in the books section of the paper they profile a different author.
This week we profile the 20-year-old singer-songwriter.

body_content.explanation: to predict the likely behaviour or description of someone such as a customer or criminal, based on what information you have about them:
examples: Sales data can be used to profile customers' behaviour .
He claims no officer would ever enforce the law by profiling a so-called "type" of person or people.
